purpose.summary: This file is the source for generating the IMS Program Specification Block (PSB) named DLIGSAMP for use in a COBOL program. It defines a database PCB (PAUTBPCB) for the hierarchical IMS database DBPAUTP0 with PROCOPT=GOTP and KEYLEN=14, providing access to root segment PAUTSUM0 (PARENT=0) and child segment PAUTDTL1 (PARENT=PAUTSUM0). It also defines two GSAM PCBs for databases PASFLDBD and PADFLDBD, both with PROCOPT=LS.

inputs.name: DBPAUTP0
inputs.description: Hierarchical IMS database accessed via PCB PAUTBPCB with segments PAUTSUM0 (root) and PAUTDTL1

inputs.name: PASFLDBD
inputs.description: GSAM IMS database accessed via unnamed PCB

inputs.name: PADFLDBD
inputs.description: GSAM IMS database accessed via unnamed PCB

open_questions.question: What is the business purpose of the DBPAUTP0 database and its segments PAUTSUM0 and PAUTDTL1?
open_questions.context: PSB defines structure and access but provides no descriptive comments on data content or business use
open_questions.suggestion: Review associated DBD source, COBOL program source using this PSB, or application documentation

open_questions.question: What do the GSAM databases PASFLDBD and PADFLDBD contain?
open_questions.context: Names suggest sequential files (possibly summary/detail logs), but no details in PSB source
open_questions.suggestion: Examine DBD definitions or programs using these PCBs

open_questions.question: What are the exact meanings of PROCOPT=GOTP for the DB PCB and PROCOPT=LS for GSAM PCBs?
open_questions.context: Standard IMS PROCOPT documented externally; GOTP implies GET with positioning/optimization, LS implies sequential load/browse, but specifics depend on IMS version
open_questions.suggestion: Consult IMS manuals for PROCOPT options applicable to these DBD types
